search_results.full_title: ​fools (can’t help falling in love) by Foster (Ft. Sody)
search_results.title: ​fools (can’t help falling in love)
search_results.lyrics:
​fools (can’t help falling in love) Lyrics[Intro]
Wise men say
Only fools rush in
And I can't help falling in love with you

[Verse 1]
I wonder if I'm ever on her mind like she's on mine
Probably not
Swear I've never seen a girl so fine
She probably got tons of guys tryna hit her line
And take her time, I guess I better step in line
She got me shook
Fell in love on the first look - typical
Always catching feelings when the feelings not reciprocal
Love is just so difficult
Builds you up then tears you down
Every time she comes around
[Verse 2]
I'ma, I'ma, I'ma, I'ma
Fool for her
Acting cool for her
She's too bad for me
But I'm too good for her
She makes me so nervous, probably on purpose
She's just so perfect
I just can't help it

[Chorus]
'Cause wise men say only fools rush in
But pretty girls make fools outta wise men
Wise men say only fools rush in
But pretty girls make fools outta wise men, like

Wise men say
Only fools rush in
But I can't help falling in love with you

[Verse 3]
Yeah, I tend to fall in love with every pretty girl I see practically
But how come they never fall in love with me, I mean gee; pardon me
But I'm better than those ass-holes you talk to
Who claim that they got you, but clearly that's not true
I feel the vibe between us
Can you feel it, too?
Or maybe I'm just trippin'
I'm just really feeling you
You on a power trip, that pretty girl power shit
Got every guy falling
You'd have Superman powerless
You might also like[Hook]
It ain't fair, I swear it ain't fair
The way she looks, I can't help, but just stare
She makes me so nervous, probably on purpose
She's just so perfect
I just can't help it

[Outro]
Cause wise men say only fools rush in
But pretty girls make fools outta wise men
Wise men say only fools rush in
But pretty girls make fools outta wise men, like

Wise men say (You know what they say)
Only fools rush in
But I can't help falling in love with you24Embed

description.plain:
Foster released snippets of this song for awhile, ultimately releasing it on November 13, 2020. “fools” was added to Spotify’s New Music Friday playlist and shot Foster’s monthly listeners up to well over 1 million.

The track allowed him to gainfully expand his audience by putting his own spin on a beloved classic. His verses contribute to the sampled lines from Elvis Presley, telling a story about love from a far. Foster describes these pretty girls and why he’s so attracted to them, admitting his weakness that is stated in the chorus sung by Sody.

In a video Foster posted to TikTok, he explains the process of how he had been driving around in the rain trying to write a new song when finally had an idea that forced him to pull over and start writing. He soon after released it on SoundCloud and YouTube, where it starting gaining traction a year later with over 1 million views on YouTube.
Foster released the original song “fool”', back on April 8, 2018 after teasing lyrics to the song on Twitter. “fool” has a longer instrumental, different cover art, and was also released independently; whereas “fools” was released by  Relentless Records under exclusive license to Sony Music Entertainment.

TranslationsEspañolTürkçe​is your bedroom ceiling bored? Lyrics[Verse 1: Sody]
I stay up late and I talk to the moon
And I can't stop telling him all about you
Wonder if you do the same thing I do
And these four white walls, they know more than my friends
They watch me type messages I'll never send
This is the place that I just can't pretend to be alright

[Chorus: Sody & Cavetown]
Is your bedroom ceiling bored like mine
Of you staring at it all the time?
'Cause it's seen so many nights where I cry and I yell at the sky
For not telling you how I feel
Is your bedroom ceiling bored
Like mine?
[Verse 2: Cavetown]
I get up early and talk to the sun
I ask her for guidance but she ain't got none
How am I supposed to know you're not the one?
I'm begging to the mirror 'cause I can't find an answer
Too busy falling apart and I wonder if you're moving on
If you are, what's your secret?
'Cause I can't work out where to start

[Chorus: Cavetown & Sody]
Is your bedroom ceiling bored like mine
Of you staring at it all the time?
'Cause it's seen so many nights where I cry and I yell at the sky
For not telling you how I feel
Is your bedroom ceiling bored
Like mine?

I stay up late and I talk to the moon
And I can't stop telling him all about you
Wonder if you do the same thing I do
I get up early and talk to the sun
I ask her for guidance but she ain't got none
Wonder if you do the same thing I do
I hope you do
You might also like[Chorus: Sody & Cavetown]
Is your bedroom ceiling bored like mine
Of you staring at it all the time?
'Cause it's seen so many nights where I cry and I yell at the sky
For not telling you how I feel
Is your bedroom ceiling bored?
Is your bedroom ceiling bored
Like mine?11Embed

annotations:
’Cause it’s seen so many nights where I cry and I yell at the sky
 For not telling you how I feel

This could have a really deep meaning.
The artists are expressing how impotent and helpless they feel for not being able to open up and therefore, keep bottling up their emotions.
They stay awake at night wondering when will they be able to express themselves truly, out of their bedrooms.
It could also mean they have insomnia for not having told someone in the past that they loved them, or being more honest with that old friend/crush/couple. Even if that can’t be undone, because it’s a thing of the past, they feel desperate about it, and overthink about what they could’ve done.

And these four white walls, they know more than my friends
 They watch me type messages I’ll never send
 This is the place that I just can’t pretend to be alright

In these lines, Sody talks about how in her bedroom, she can let go. Those walls have seen more than even her closest friends have. Her bedroom is the only place where she can’t pretend to be okay, and lets her true emotions out.

description.plain:
In “Maybe It Was Me,“ Sody reflects on a past relationship. She considers the possibility of herself being part of the blame as to why it failed. Accompanied by simple chords, the themes of selfishness and stubbornness are explored in the song, resulting in the realization that our faults can help us grow.

The song was written about one of Sody’s ex-boyfriends. She explained:

It’s me reflecting on the relationship and accepting that maybe I wasn’t as kind and mindful as I could have been. It’s a sort of apology for my actions.

Sody released the song alongside a music video, which shows close-ups of her face while she is singing the song in different locations.

search_results.title: Bedroom Ceiling
search_results.lyrics:
Bedroom Ceiling Lyrics[Verse 1]
I stay up late and I talk to the moon
And I can't stop telling him all about you
Wonder if you do the same thing I do
And these four white walls they know more than my friends
They watch me type messages I'll never send
This is the place that I just can't pretend to be alright

[Chorus]
Is your bedroom ceiling bored like mine
Of you staring at it all the time
'Cause it's seen so many nights where I cry and I yell at the sky
For not telling you how I feel
Is your bedroom ceiling bored
Like mine?
[Verse 2]
I get up early and talk to the sun
I ask her for guidance but she ain't got none
How am I supposed to know you're not the one?
I'm begging to the mirror 'cause I can't find an answer
Too busy falling apart and I wonder if you're moving on
If you are, what's your secret?
'Cause I can't work out where to start

[Chorus]
Is your bedroom ceiling bored like mine
Of you staring at it all the time
'Cause it's seen so many nights while I cry and I yell at the sky
For not telling you how I feel
Is your bedroom ceiling bored
Like mine?

[Bridge]
I stay up late and I talk to the moon
And I can't stop telling him all about you
Wonder if you do the same thing I do
I hope you do

[Chorus]
Is your bedroom ceiling bored like mine
Of you staring at it all the time
'Cause it's seen so many nights while I cry and I yell at the sky
For not telling you how I feel
Is your bedroom ceiling bored
Is your bedroom ceiling bored
Like mine?You might also like6Embed

description.plain: This is a song about feeling disconnected and quite literally spending days in your room, staring at your ceiling and wishing your life would change.

song.embed_content: Read “Bedroom Ceiling” by Sody on Genius
song.title: Bedroom Ceiling

body.plain: This is a song about feeling disconnected and quite literally spending days in your room, staring at your ceiling and wishing your life would change.

songs.full_title: ​is your bedroom ceiling bored? by Sody & Cavetown
songs.title: ​is your bedroom ceiling bored?

annotations:
’Cause it’s seen so many nights where I cry and I yell at the sky
 For not telling you how I feel

This could have a really deep meaning.
The artist is expressing how impotent and helpless she feels for not being able to open up and therefore, keep bottling up her emotions.
She stays awake at night wondering when will she be able to express herself truly, out of her bedroom.
It could also mean that she has insomnia for not having told someone in the past that she loved them, or being more honest with that old friend/crush/couple. Even if that can’t be undone, because it’s a thing of the past, she feels desperate about it, and overthink about what she could’ve done.

Too busy falling apart and I wonder if you’re moving on
 If you are, what’s your secret?

The lyrics here mean that they’re in the recovery/wondering period of time where they constantly worry about their ex and see if they’re moving on. They keep falling apart at these thoughts, yet, the thoughts stay in the heads of those who are beating themselves up over not moving on quick enough, or not being good enough for their ex. They want to know the “secret” of moving on.

And these four white walls they know more than my friends
 They watch me type messages I’ll never send
 This is the place that I just can’t pretend to be alright

These lines were further elaborated by Sody on her Spotify bio:

It’s when you write paragraphs to someone over text but then delete it and respond ‘I’m okay!‘.
